title: Riot not giving credit?
body:
I've just gotta say, as someone who has entered player creations before, and is an artist in real life, sure I can understand submitting a creation to the boards for fun and for the love of the game, but when I read Riot's recent champion insight on Kindred, I was slightly annoyed.

(http://euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/champions-skins/champion-preview/champion-insights-kindred-eternal-hunters )

It is obvious that Kindred was inspired from the player creation Dhama, submitted to the boards in NA by Samuel Youn.

(http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/NRFvUWr4-champion-concept-dhama-the-force-of-balance-art-and-concept-by-samuel-youn )

And yet Riot couldn't even acknowledge that fact in their article above, writing some B.S. about how they had to come up with a jungle marksman and filling the article with art and concept designs that are far inferior to the original art work by Youn. Was he contacted? Did they at least give him a private deal? I just think it's unfair if they didn't, when he submitted an idea he obviously spent a fair amount of time on, only to have it used and not credited.

I'm happy to still submit player creations and hope others do too, but I'd hope if they used one as completely as they did with Dhama, that they'd at least give a slight nod of credit to the original author, rather than write articles on the new champion completely disregarding this fact.

I don't think this would be Riot. Well I hope not. If I submit an idea, I'd hope they'd use it and they could use it free. Just when they've used so much of a concept, it'd be cool if they didn't ignore my contribution completely or write articles making out that the idea was completely and entirely theirs with no outside input.

May I direct you to the [Terms Of Use](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse), section IV "Ownership", C "Unsolicited Idea Submissions" which states, and I quote:

>... You hereby authorize Riot Games and its designees, assignees and licensees ... (3) to use the Unsolicited Ideas with indication of your name as an author or **without such indication at its sole discretion** ...

Having agreed to the Terms Of Use upon creating their account the person who submitted their "unsolicited idea", as the TOU calls it, gave all rights for the idea, and the option to credit them (or not) for the idea, to Riot.

It would have been better if Riot did give credit for the original concept to the original author but the fact remains it's solely Riot's choice on whether they credit people for ideas submitted to them.

Nice info, will give you a +1 for that.

That said, let's be honest and ask who actually reads the Terms and Conditions of any website they use, and that hidden gem of a condition is actually quite common on many sites, but never utilised. You could argue that someone who has spent as much time on a concept and is obviously an artist, that they should be concerned with such things before posting a concept to the boards.

A good medium would be to re-state this on the description of the Player Creation board, maybe saying something like "Submissions may be used without credit/compensation, so submit carefully. You've been warned." At least then it's in plain english and in plain sight.

But yeah, it would have been cool if they at least gave a little credit to the original author. Even a secret Kindred skin gift to his account. I mean they didn't just use a name, or a tiny portion of the champion. They took a fair chunk of it. It just leaves a bad taste in your mouth. Either way I'd be stoked, but it's just the principle.
